010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting.AffineFit2D;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents an affine transformation in 2D, which can be defined 
020 * by three pairs of corresponding points.
021 * It can be assumed that every instance of this class is indeed an affine mapping.
022 */
023public class AffineMapping2D extends ProjectiveMapping2D {
024
025        /**
026         * Creates an affine 2D mapping from two sequences of corresponding points.
027         * If 3 point pairs are specified, the mapping is exact, otherwise a
028         * minimum least-squares fit is calculated.
029         * @param P the source points
030         * @param Q the target points
031         * @return a new affine mapping for the two point sets
032         */
033        public static AffineMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
034                AffineFit2D fit = new AffineFit2D(P, Q);
035                return new AffineMapping2D(fit.getTransformationMatrix());
036        }
037        
038        /**
039         * Creates an affine mapping from an arbitrary 2D triangle A to another triangle B.
040         * In this case the solution is found in closed form 
041         * (see Burger/Burge 2016, Sec. 21.1.3, eq. 21.26).
042         * @param A1 point 1 of source triangle A
043         * @param A2 point 2 of source triangle A
044         * @param A3 point 3 of source triangle A
045         * @param B1 point 1 of source triangle B
046         * @param B2 point 2 of source triangle B
047         * @param B3 point 3 of source triangle B
048         * @return a new affine mapping
049         * @deprecated
050         */
051        public static AffineMapping2D from3Points(Pnt2d A1, Pnt2d A2, Pnt2d A3, Pnt2d B1, Pnt2d B2, Pnt2d B3) {
052                double ax1 = A1.getX(), ax2 = A2.getX(), ax3 = A3.getX();
053                double ay1 = A1.getY(), ay2 = A2.getY(), ay3 = A3.getY();
054                double bx1 = B1.getX(), bx2 = B2.getX(), bx3 = B3.getX();
055                double by1 = B1.getY(), by2 = B2.getY(), by3 = B3.getY();
056
057                double S = ax1 * (ay3 - ay2) + ax2 * (ay1 - ay3) + ax3 * (ay2 - ay1); //
058                if (Arithmetic.isZero(S)) {
059                        throw new ArithmeticException("from3Points(): division by zero!");
060                }
061                double a00 = (ay1 * (bx2 - bx3) + ay2 * (bx3 - bx1) + ay3 * (bx1 - bx2)) / S;
062                double a01 = (ax1 * (bx3 - bx2) + ax2 * (bx1 - bx3) + ax3 * (bx2 - bx1)) / S;
063                double a10 = (ay1 * (by2 - by3) + ay2 * (by3 - by1) + ay3 * (by1 - by2)) / S;
064                double a11 = (ax1 * (by3 - by2) + ax2 * (by1 - by3) + ax3 * (by2 - by1)) / S;
065                double a02 = (ax1*(ay3*bx2-ay2*bx3) + ax2*(ay1*bx3-ay3*bx1) + ax3*(ay2*bx1-ay1*bx2)) / S;
066                double a12 = (ax1*(ay3*by2-ay2*by3) + ax2*(ay1*by3-ay3*by1) + ax3*(ay2*by1-ay1*by2)) / S;
067                return new AffineMapping2D(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12);
068        }
069        
070//      /**
071//       * Creates an affine mapping from an arbitrary 2D triangle A to another triangle B.
072//       * @param A the first triangle
073//       * @param B the second triangle
074//       * @return a new affine mapping
075//       * @deprecated
076//       */
077//      public static AffineMapping2D from3Points(Point[] A, Point[] B) {
078//              return AffineMapping2D.from3Points(A[0], A[1], A[2], B[0], B[1], B[2]);
079//      }
080        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        /**
083         * Creates the identity mapping.
084         */
085        public AffineMapping2D() {
086                super();
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix A,
091         * which must be at least of size 2 x 3.
092         * The elements of A are copied into a 3x3 identity matrix.
093         * If A is larger than 2 x 3, the remaining elements are ignored.
094         * @param A a 2 x 3(or larger) matrix
095         */
096        public AffineMapping2D(double[][] A) {
097                //super(A[0][0], A[0][1], A[0][2], A[1][0], A[1][1], A[1][2], 0, 0);
098                super(extractAffineMatrix(A));
099        }
100        
101        private static double[][] extractAffineMatrix(double[][] A) {
102                double[][] M = Matrix.idMatrix(3);
103                final int m = Math.min(2, A.length);    // max. 2 rows
104                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
105                        final int n = Math.min(3, A[i].length); // max. 3 columns
106                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
107                                M[i][j] = A[i][j];
108                        }
109                }
110                return M;
111        }
112
113        /**
114         * Creates an affine mapping from the specified matrix elements.
115         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
116         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
117         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
118         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
119         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
120         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
121         */
122        public AffineMapping2D (
123                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
124                        double a10, double a11, double a12) {
125                super(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12, 0, 0);
126        }
127
128        /**
129         * Creates a new affine mapping from an existing affine mapping.
130         * @param m an affine mapping
131         */
132        public AffineMapping2D(AffineMapping2D m) {
133                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a02, m.a10, m.a11, m.a11);
134        }
135        
136        // ----------------------------------------------------------
137        
138        /** Deviation limit for checking 0 and 1 values. */
139        protected static double AffineTolerance = 1e-15;
140        
141        /**
142         * Checks if the given linear mapping could be affine, i.e. if the
143         * bottom row of its transformation matrix is (0, 0, 1). 
144         * Note that this is a necessary but not sufficient requirement.
145         * The threshold {@link AffineTolerance} is used in this check.
146         * @param map a linear mapping
147         * @return true if the mapping could be affine
148         */
149        public static boolean isAffine(LinearMapping2D map) {
150                if (Math.abs(map.a20) > AffineTolerance) return false;
151                if (Math.abs(map.a21) > AffineTolerance) return false;
152                if (Math.abs(map.a22 - 1.0) > AffineTolerance) return false;
153                return true;
154        }
155
156        /**
157         * Concatenates this mapping A with another affine mapping B and returns
158         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
159         * @param B the second mapping
160         * @return the concatenated affine mapping
161         */
162        public AffineMapping2D concat(AffineMapping2D B) {      // use some super method instead?
163                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
164                return new AffineMapping2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[0][2], C[1][0], C[1][1], C[1][2]);
165        }
166
167        /**
168         * {@inheritDoc}
169         * Note that inverting an affine transformation always yields
170         * another affine transformation.
171         */
172        @Override
173        public AffineMapping2D getInverse() {
174                double det = a00 * a11 - a01 * a10;
175                double b00 = a11 / det;
176                double b01 = -a01 / det;
177                double b02 = (a01 * a12 - a02 * a11) / det;
178                double b10 = -a10 / det;
179                double b11 = a00 / det;
180                double b12 = (a02 * a10 - a00 * a12) / det;
181                return new AffineMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12);
182        }
183
184        /**
185         * {@inheritDoc}
186         * @return a new affine mapping
187         */
188        @Override
189        public AffineMapping2D duplicate() {
190                return new AffineMapping2D(this);
191        }
192
193        @Override
194        public double[][] getJacobian(Pnt2d xy) {
195                final double x = xy.getX();
196                final double y = xy.getY();
197                return new double[][]
198                        {{x, y, 0, 0, 1, 0},
199                         {0, 0, x, y, 0, 1}};
200        }
201        
202        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
203        
204        /**
205         * For testing only.
206         * @param args ignored
207         */
208        public static void main(String[] args) {
209                PrintPrecision.set(6);
210                double[][] A = 
211                        {{-2, 4, -3}, 
212                        {3, 7, 2}, 
213                        {0, 0, 1}};
214                System.out.println("a = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
215                System.out.println();
216                double[][] ai = Matrix.inverse(A);
217                System.out.println("ai = \n" + Matrix.toString(ai));
218                
219                LinearMapping2D Ai = new LinearMapping2D(ai);
220                System.out.println("Ai is affine: " + isAffine(Ai));
221                
222                double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, ai);
223                System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
224                
225                double[][] B = 
226                        {{-2, 4, -3}, 
227                        {3, 7, 2}};
228                
229                LinearMapping2D am = new AffineMapping2D(B);
230                System.out.println("an = \n" + Matrix.toString(am.getTransformationMatrix()));
231        }
232
233}
234
